title: Reading
content: Introduction #  Joseph Brodsky List of 83 Books #   Bhagavad Gita Mahabharata Gilgamesh The Old Testament Homer: Iliad, Odyssey Herodotus: Histories Sophocles: Plays Aeschylus: Plays Euripides: Plays (Hippolytus, The Bachantes, Electra, The Phoenician Women) Thucydides: The Peloponnesian War Plato: Dialogues Aristotle: Poetics, Physics, Ethics, De Anima Alexandrian Poetry: The Greek Anthology Lucretius: On the Nature of Things Plutarch: Lives [presumably Parallel Lives] Virgil: Aeneid, Bucolics, Georgics Tacitus: Annals Ovid: Metamorphoses, Heroides, Amores The New Testament Suetonius: The Twelve Caesars Marcus Aurelius: Meditations Catullus: Poems Horace: Poems Epictetus: Discourses Aristophanes: Plays Claudius Aelianus: Historical Miscellany, On the Nature of Animals Apollonius Rhodius: Argonautica Michael Psellus: Fourteen Byzantine Rulers Edward Gibbon: The Rise and Fall of the Roman Empire Plotinus: The Enneads Eusebius: Ecclesiastical History Boethius: Consolations of Philosophy Pliny the Younger: Letters Byzantine verse romances Heraclitus: Fragments St. Augustine: Confessions Thomas Aquinas: Summa Theologica St. Francis of Assisi: The Little Flowers Niccolò Machiavelli: The Prince Dante Alighieri: Divine Comedy (Tr. By John Ciardi) Franco Sacchetti: Novelle Icelandic sagas William Shakespeare (Anthony and Cleopatra, Hamlet, Macbeth, Henry V) François Rabelais Francis Bacon Martin Luther: Selected Works John Calvin: Institutio Christianae religionis Michel de Montaigne: Essays Miguel de Cervantes: Don Quixote René Descartes: Discourses Song of Roland Beowulf Benvenuto Cellini Henry Adams: Education of Henry Adams Thomas Hobbes: The Leviathan Blaise Pascal: Pensées John Milton: Paradise Lost John Donne Andrew Marvell George Herbert Richard Crashaw Baruch Spinoza: Treatises Stendhal: Charterhouse of Parma, Red and Black, The Life of Henry Brulard Jonathan Swift: Gulliver’s Travels Laurence Sterne: Tristram Shandy Choderlos de Laclos: Les Liaisons Dangereuses Baron de Montesquieu: Persian Letters John Locke: Second Treatise on Government Adam Smith: The Wealth of Nations Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz: Discourse on Metaphysics David Hume: Everything The Federalist Papers Immanuel Kant: Critique of Pure Reason Søren Kierkegaard: Fear and Trembling, Either/Or, Philosophical Fragments Fyodor Dostoevsky: Notes From the Underground, The Possessed Alexis de Tocqueville: Democracy in America Johann Wolfgang von Goethe: Faust, Italian Journey Astolphe-Louis-Léonor, Marquis de Custine: Empire of the Czar: A Journey Through Eternal Russia Eric Auerbach: Mimesis William H. Prescott: Conquest of Mexico Octavio Paz: Labyrinths of Solitude Sir Karl Popper: The Logic of Scientific Discovery, The Open Society and Its Enemies Elias Canetti: Crowds and Power
